title: Supreme Court Clears Way for Trump Administration’s Mass Firings of Federal Workers
summary: The justices announced they were not ruling on the legality of the specific downsizing plans but they allowed the Trump administration to proceed for now with its restructuring efforts.

title: U.S. Botched a Deal to Swap Venezuelans in El Salvador for American Prisoners
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and the U.S. envoy to Venezuela were both working on different deals and ended up at cross purposes.

title: Trump and Bondi, Confronted Over Epstein Files, Tell Supporters to Move On
summary: A small but influential cohort of the president’s far-right political coalition spared him their ire but turned with a vengeance on the attorney general and the top officials at the F.B.I.

title: Trump Uses Cabinet Meeting to Vent About Epstein, Putin and Powell
summary: The president held forth in public for 104 minutes, using a cabinet meeting to express much that is on his mind.

title: Two Found, Two Missing: An Agonizing Search After the Texas Floods
summary: Four friends, all in their 20s, planned to spend the weekend in the Hill Country. Then the rains came.

title: Abbott Calls Seeking Blame for Floods ‘the Word Choice of Losers’
summary: As both the death toll and number of questions about official preparedness increased, the Texas governor invoked football metaphors, saying “every team makes mistakes.”

title: Why the Texas Floods Were So Deadly
summary: Scientists say a hotter planet is driving more intense storms. But experts say the U.S. is also not doing enough to adapt to increasingly intense floods.

title: What Is a Trade Deal? Trump Takes an Expansive View.
summary: The president is deploying the word “deal” liberally, using the term to describe all kinds of trade arrangements, some very limited or one-sided.

title: Against Illegal Immigration, but Married to Someone Here Illegally
summary: Chris Allred’s views were shaped by economic changes. Now, facing an immigration crackdown, where do he and his wife go from here?

title: How Insularity Defined the Last Stages of Biden’s Career
summary: The effort by Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s inner circle to limit access to him helps explain why it took him more than three weeks to drop his re-election bid after his disastrous debate performance.

title: With a Nobel Prize Nomination, Netanyahu Is the Latest to Use Flattery to Woo Trump
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel handed a letter to President Trump nominating him for the Nobel Peace Prize. But it’s not clear whether stroking the president’s ego has long-lasting effects.

title: Attack on Cargo Ship in the Red Sea Kills 2 Crew Members
summary: The incident occurred a day after Houthi militants in Yemen targeted another vessel, their first assault on shipping since President Trump announced a truce with them.

title: Antigovernment Protests Erupt Across Kenya, Killing Dozens
summary: Simmering anger against President William Ruto’s government has boiled over into clashes between protesters and the police, who have deployed live rounds, tear gas and water cannons.

title: Should New York City Ditch Its Party Primaries in Favor of Open Races?
summary: A panel created by Mayor Eric Adams wants to consider using an “open primary” system for elections in New York City. Here’s how the plan would work.

title: ‘Superman’ Review: It’s a Bird, It’s a Plane, It’s a Reboot!
summary: Beginning again with the Man of Steel, this time in the hands of James Gunn.

title: Trash Overflows in Philadelphia as City Workers’ Strike Enters Second Week
summary: Pungent odors permeate the City of Brotherly Love as a contract impasse between the city and the American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees continues.

title: For Israel, It Pays to Be a Winner
summary: Diplomatic breakthroughs in the Middle East are the result of military victories.

title: Musk’s Third Party Starts With a Good Idea
summary: Is there a way to elect an independent bloc of senators?

title: The Supreme Court Cleared the Way for Mass Federal Firings
summary: Also, Trump accused Putin of duplicity. Here’s the latest at the end of Tuesday.

title: Grok, Elon Musk’s AI Chatbot, Shares Antisemitic Posts on X
summary: The artificial intelligence chatbot, which has a dedicated account on X, praised Hitler after fielding a query about a user’s comments on the Texas flood.

title: Royal Family Welcomes President Macron to U.K. for State Visit With Pomp and Pizazz
summary: President Emmanuel Macron is on a state visit to Britain, the first of a French leader since 2008. His hosts are drenching him in pomp, pizazz and protocol.

title: Mayor and Police Chiefs Let Corruption Fester at N.Y.P.D., Suits Charge
summary: The lawsuits, by four former police officers, claim that a culture of cronyism ruled the department. James Essig, who was chief of detectives, said that promotions were sold for $15,000.

title: Colorado Judge Fines MyPillow Founder’s Lawyers for Error-Filled Court Filing
summary: The judge said the lawyers had not explained how such errors could have been filed “absent the use of generative artificial intelligence or gross carelessness by counsel.”
